website_summaries.verdict: Never use a knife again to remove kernels from the cob, this is the fastest, safest way to remove kernels off a cob.
pros: This tool does the job more efficiently, faster, and safer than a knife
Works on cooked or uncooked corn
Most feel this tool strips the entire kernel off the cob
Rubber shield covers blade so that you don't cut yourself when searching through drawers for it
Sharp enough that even those with arthritis can successfully use it
cons: To avoid a mess, use the product over a large bowl or baking sheet so that kernels have plenty of places to go besides your counter top and floor
Although this is dishwasher safe, the most satisfied owners hand wash them

customer_reviews.title: Seriously don't waste your money if you put up a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews but after all the raves here I purchased this tool. Maybe we just grow big corn here in Nebraska, the metal opening does NOT cut the whole kernal off the cob. After several tries the cutter piece fell out of the plastic handle. I'm coming back to my electric knife. Seriously don't waste your money if you put up a lot of sweet corn.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Kalin

customer_reviews.title: After Many Ears of Corn Perfectly Stripped of Kernels for Recipes and the Freezer I'm Reviewing
customer_reviews.text: Have tried numerous products for removing the kernels from the cob without much success. We live directly across from a farm that grows some of the best sweet corn in Ohio and I always like to freeze a bunch for the winter. This little tool is simply amazing - easy to use and removes the kernels perfectly without waste. Highly Recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: igolf2

customer_reviews.title: Great service
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, LOVE this product. I bought the whole set from QVC, with the holders. I liked it so much that I wanted to have an extra zipper so I came back to my favorite place to shop, (Amazon) and ordered this one. If you want an awesome and easy way to get all the corn off the cob.... grab at least... one of these. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Masterson

customer_reviews.title: Corn Stripper that works!
customer_reviews.text: Have tried other ways of removing kernels of corn from cob for freezing. This one works well and is very sharp...Caution! Keep your fingers out of the way! I held the tip of the corncob in the hole of a bundt pan which I had placed in a very large jellyroll type of pan to catch the corn as I stripped the cob. It does create quite a mess around the area of the pan so the bigger the pan the better! Saw a demo of this on YouTube and it worked as well as demonstrated!
customer_reviews.author: Lil

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to more easily cut corn off of the cob after it was boiled. I was not able to use this tool to effectively cut off the kernels. I had better luck when I used used a butter knife on the cob of corn inside a bowl. The corn is too hot to hold in your hand and run the corn zipper down the cob. Using a corn holder did not work either. It caused the cob to slip out of my and and scatter cut corn kernels all across the counter. I was very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Blade came flying out on third use.
customer_reviews.text: Broke on third use. Blade came flying out. I managed to get it back in with a pair of needle nose pliers without cutting myself. Would NOT recommend buying this. Obviously one of those tools for people who buy gadgets but don't actually cook. And no, it hasn't been put through the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: ducksinarow

customer_reviews.title: BLADE GOT DULL AFTER ONLY A COUPLE USES
customer_reviews.text: The first couple times I used it, I thought it was great. Now, after only about four uses, the blade seems to have dulled, making it hard to pull through the kernels, and, as a result, making them fly all over. Really had high expectations for this product, as I have usually been pleased with Kuhn Rikon products, but I guess I will be going back to my knife method.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had 6 ears of corn and tried different methods with each one. I think the secret to using this is to lay the ear on a flat surface, horizontally. Works well with out too much of a mess. Vertically, whether in a bowl or on a flat surface you get a lot of kernels flying.
customer_reviews.author: Carol G. Nye

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!  Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a corn lover. He buys fresh corn all summer since getting this! It’s not hard to clean, but keep the cover/guard so you don’t Knick yourself when you are grabbing it. Easy to use, my corn lover loves to prep his own corn for dinner now. I can’t eat corn, so it’s a win win for me!
customer_reviews.author: Super Lisa

customer_reviews.title: It works okay... pricey for being a one-trick product
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any safety issues with this product like some other users, thankfully, but after reading about some cuts and gashes I have been extra cautious while using it. It's a very specialized product, and it works okay, but it has a tendency to make shallow rows of cuts if you don't align the blade just right, and then it's difficult to recut over those kernels. I'd be more likely to recommend this if it were in the $5-$6 range instead of $12.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Frantz

customer_reviews.title: I approve!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Easy to hold. Seem durable. Might warp if boiled or used in extreme hot corn. Overall very happy so far. I’ve used them a few times and think they will hold up for years. Definitely worth it compared to other ones I got duped on.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebeebabyboy’s 5 Star Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I look for this sooner
customer_reviews.text: I have been cutting corn off the cob for years, my tired hands after cutting corn off of 5 dozen cobs!! This is a snap to use and so quick. Works great, sharp and easy to hold. Once you get a rhythm down it's PERFECTION~!~ Love it
customer_reviews.author: Tlh

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my 90-yr-old Mom.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Place a plate in the sink and rest the cob on the plate. Some kernels will pop off into the sink. Takes the kernels off the cob quickly and safely. After stripping the kernels, flip the device and use the dull side and go down the cob again. This kind of “squeezes out the juice” for delicious creamed corn.
customer_reviews.author: Klaren

customer_reviews.title: it started as a gag but it's awesome
customer_reviews.text: I got this half as a joke because of my dental work i have to strip corn BUT, holee cow, this thing is amazing, it slides entire sides of corn off the cob perfectly. i like the nubbins and corn milk so I go around a second time, this thing is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Trace

customer_reviews.title: Nice little kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: This corn zipper does a GREAT job! My only advice is to strip the corn into a large bowl, not onto a plate. It does take a try to get the right angle for optimum stripping. Overall a 5 star product!
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Craig

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good....
customer_reviews.text: It works especially well on cooked corn cobs, but can work on raw cobs as well, just be careful not to dislodge the blade (happened to us, but we were able to snap it back into place).
customer_reviews.author: ButterYum

customer_reviews.title: Tried this last year when I froze our sweet corn. It doesn't work very well
customer_reviews.text: Tried this last year when I froze our sweet corn. It doesn't work very well. Hard to hold and makes my hand and fingers hurt. Back to the old serrated knife, and not an electric knife for me. I want to get all the corn kernel and all the milky juice, so by hand is the best way for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bookwalker

customer_reviews.title: Great easy way to remove corn from cob
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic. In no time, you have all the corn from the cob on your plate. Because of dental work, I have been unable to eat it off the cob. For 2 years I have been using a knife-risky and not getting all the corn. I've already ordered a second one for my aunt.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super fast & easy to take corn off the cob!
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who cuts the corn off the cob for Mexican street corn or a variety of other dishes, this gadget makes it super easy. It is sharp, has a good grip, and also easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: DeMay

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mother-in-law who has some problems with her teeth. She loves it and brags about how great it is all the time to people.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Ansel

customer_reviews.title: Best summer kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: This was the very best tool I've used to remove corn from the cob. It's very quick & easy!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: No problem with cover for me.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why people are getting cut by taking off the cover. Maybe the company changed it after people were injured. Just opened mine and it the cover came off really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous for 'zipping' ears of corn!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to strip ears of corn quickly. Doesn't destroy the kernels either. Does a wide swath and is the usual high quality of Kuhn Rikon. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Pat J.

customer_reviews.title: life changing in every way!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god!! finally a corn zipper I can trust. For years, literally years I have been cutting the corn kernals off the cob with those sharp thingies in my mouth. Don't get me wrong, using those sharp mouth thingies to bite off the corn from that pesky cob is effective BUT is it safe. Finally, I now have a safe and effective way to eat corn! Thank you corn zipper, your the greatest! What I need now is a chicken leg zipper because, well you know, I'm using those mouth thingies for that and it scares me.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is so cool! It actually zips the corn off the cob. I found it works best when the corn is still warm but not cool to touch. Absolutely love it- a real time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Jean E. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Kitchen Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing a similar product at a family gathering. For someone who loves corn on the cob flavor, but doesn't enjoy the accompanying mess, this product is perfect. I was able to cut off all of the corn from the cob. It appears that you can get more corn off the cob by using this Zipper than if you were eating it only with your teeth. It works great and looks good!
customer_reviews.author: Curzpemmel

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has permanent retainers attached to my teeth after years of orthodontics, I love this product. I can't easily eat corn on the cob, and previously having to cut it off the ear was annoying. Now, it's painless. I wish I knew about this product 10 years ago, so I could enjoy corn with my braces on! It's very easy to use and I'll be recommending this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: What a timesaver!
customer_reviews.text: OK, my husband and I are not much for gadgets, particularly very specialized gadgets. But this thing now holds a place of honor in our kitchen tool drawer. We grew corn two years ago and our biggest beef was trying to get it off the cob quickly and effectively. The knife was (pardon the pun) just not cutting it. Enter the zipper! We could get all the kernels off an ear with just four effortless passes of this mighty fine little tool. Thank you for offering it! Readying our corn for the freezer just got much, much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Good Brother Cadfael

customer_reviews.title: Corn Zipper
customer_reviews.text: It lives up to its name. This little item zips the corn right off the cob nicely. After one pass of cutting off the corn kernels, we flip the zipper over and run the back blade down to corn ear to release the juices. It is comfortable to hold and sharp. We put 55 packages of corn in the freezer using this zipper so it certainly has been tested. I probably will order another so that two of us can work at the same time. This is a very nice product and the cost is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: cjmac

customer_reviews.title: Good product but...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great overall but be careful with it. The blades are mean especially when cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: michigangirl

customer_reviews.title: Worked so great. Tried many over the years this thing worked ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked so great. Tried many over the years this thing worked the best. Took just a bit to get the right angle and pressure but it really works and I am glad I bought two!
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Be safe: Use this not a knife.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know I needed one of these. I discovered it might not be a bad idea to tryin after trying to use a knife to remove corn on the cob. Bad idea. Very bad idea. This thing works and lowers the safety risk.
customer_reviews.author: AMY L STINE

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So so easy and quick quick did 6 ears of corn in very short time...canning corn is going to be an easy chore this summer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tool - especially for a novice
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I froze 6 dozen ears of corn one evening last week. I used a knife and he used the zipper. (He had never done this work before). The corn zipper is VERY VERY SHARP and there is a small learning curve with learning to use it - while avoiding cutting your own fingers. If you have those little corn cob holders that you eat corn with - would make the job much easier. This tool made the job easier for a novice - but I think I work faster with a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Wendi Spraker

customer_reviews.title: Best gadget ever!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life? I love fresh corn salad and this gadget made it so easy to make. It’s easy and safe. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: KritterRAE

customer_reviews.title: The first two ears sliced like a breeze and I would have rated 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Boo-hoo. The top slicer blade broke in the middle of the third ear of corn. The first two ears sliced like a breeze and I would have rated 5 stars. Clearly the workmanship is sub- par. I'm going to send this back to Amazon and won't take a chance on another.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Microwavable!
customer_reviews.text: We enjoy microwaving fresh corn, and these are perfect! Easy to use and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Just use a knife. This does not work. More junky products.
customer_reviews.author: 29shop64

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Calling it the corn zipper is very descriptive as that’s just how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Item Broke After First Use
customer_reviews.text: I used this on two ears of corn and it broke. Great idea but not well made. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: F. S. Moss

customer_reviews.title: Another great product by Kuhn Rikon
customer_reviews.text: I do not buy or eat canned foods. My family LOVES corn chowder, corn pudding, and sauteed corn! I only make those dishes a few times a year because removing corn from the cob with a knife is very time consuming. Although there are probably numerous others on the market, this is the first corn kernel remover I've ever tried that does exactly what it is purported to do. In my opinion, it's another great little gadget by Kuhn Rikon. Be sure to keep your fingers out of the way; this thing is SHARP!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: A must have gaget
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, it has changed my life when trying to make corn dishes
customer_reviews.author: Judy N

customer_reviews.title: Essential for the fresh corn lover
customer_reviews.text: This item is fantastic! Works incredibly well better than the other ones I tried. I would highly recommend this item especially for older people who have difficulties. I have used this with fresh corn on the cob and what is cooked. It works well with either one
customer_reviews.author: Dear 49Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Corn cob holders
customer_reviews.text: Have had these before and like the way they work so I bought a set for friends as a gift. They enjoy them too.
customer_reviews.author: DR SUSIE

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love. After years for cutting corn off the cob to freeze with a butcher knife and trying all of the gadgets that didn't work, finally found one that did. Bouggt both of my daugters one too, they loved them too.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Better than the metal prongs!
customer_reviews.text: Who would use anything else? Easy to store since they fit together. So easy to put in corn. Buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect !
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Very well made with some nice safety features.
customer_reviews.author: Bearcat Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great corn stripper!
customer_reviews.text: Great corn stripper! Does a fantastic job of easily removing kernels! Best we have ever used!
customer_reviews.author: RWG

customer_reviews.title: not one ear
customer_reviews.text: item broke before I could finish one ear of corn. I was only able to swipe two rows and the blade broke off the handle.
customer_reviews.author: bob horn

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: It took some getting used to. Once I realized that it worked better when you used it sideways instead of trying to use it on top of the corn cob. It went a lot smoother. I seemed to be able to save a lot more corn. Now my daughter and Mother-in-law want to do kernel corn also. My husband also informed me yesterday after eating kernel corn that he much preferred kernel corn. So today I am going to do up some more.
customer_reviews.author: TAMMY

customer_reviews.title: Wow! That was easy!
customer_reviews.text: If you like corn off the cob get this tool! I was amazed at how easy it is to use and how quickly it stripes the corn off the cob. I'm not a gadget fan but this is great.
customer_reviews.author: NewHopeDogOwner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: If you like to grill corn, this is a perfect tool for stripping the kernels for easy serving.
customer_reviews.author: DRH

customer_reviews.title: I can not believe how great this worked
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I can not believe how great this worked. I cleaned 8 ears of corn in less than 5 minutes. The blade is very sharp so supervise the kids please.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. My only beef is holding the cob while keeping fingers out of harms way can be difficult. This is a very sharp tool that you don't want on your fingers. Otherwise works as advertised. I've had good luck with all KR products.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Cate

customer_reviews.title: This devise works great, easily takes off the kernels in whole chunks
customer_reviews.text: My daughter, since she started loosing her baby teeth, was having trouble with corn on the cob. A straight knife misses a lot of the kernels or makes very small pieces. This devise works great, easily takes off the kernels in whole chunks. I've used to make corn salad as well.
customer_reviews.author: Marie-luise Faber

customer_reviews.title: No surprise metal prong to bite!
customer_reviews.text: My husband hates the metal corn holders!!!!! When I found these with only one insert and it not being metal, I bought them! They are perfect! Easy to insert with a twist and have not accidentally bitten a prong that may have bent or been inserted off-center!
customer_reviews.author: Gemsfreak

customer_reviews.title: Cuts off corn in whole pieces
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I was hoping for. I make Chipa Guazu and my old method left everything pulverized and mushy. The keeps the kernels whole for the most part and my dish wasn't soggy. It was the best I've ever made it and my daughter asked for 3 helpings!!
customer_reviews.author: DOK

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool, very sharp as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool. Very sharp as folks have commented on before, and there's even plenty of warning stickers on the packaging to warn you. Assuming of course you're smart enough to read before picking up a kitchen utensil so you don't cut your fingers off. I tried it on a couple cobs of corn and it really does zip right down it without cutting into the cob. Love it. I'll be ordering a couple more.
customer_reviews.author: Failtelorn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent produce
customer_reviews.text: Really makes taking the kernels off a cob of corn so easy and love that it's dishwasher safe. I've used it mostly after grilling corn on the cob. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works amazingly well for getting corn off of the cob. I'll be using to a lot this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. it is simply amazing. Put up about 30 bags of corn in the freezer, and zip, it was done. Would be great for anyone who has a child with braces. It came the first time without a shield (highly important - take shield off holding on the ends (not where blade is). I sent it back and within about 3-4 days had a new one with the shield on it. No questions asked, they fixed the problem. Would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: This makes cutting corn on the cob easy to cut off!
customer_reviews.author: 4patsysue

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Had 40 ears of corn kernels off and bagged in no time. Easy to use, comfortable to hold and cleans up in dishwasher..very sharp. Replace the blade cover when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Schartz

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever!
customer_reviews.text: This item is so easy to use. My husband has no teeth, but I love corn on the cob. I've always tried to use a knife for his. I would highly recommend this to anyone who cuts corn off the cob.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma of 11

customer_reviews.title: Quickly prepares cut corn off the cob
customer_reviews.text: I had to shuck and prepare over a hundred ears of corn for canning and this little marvel made short work of the task! Yes, it's very sharp and you must be cautious when removing the cover but I have never had such an easy time of preparing corn for canning in my life! The last ear of corn (number 104!) was as easy as the first. If you can summer corn this is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: L Parr

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This works great, gets all the corn and no mess. I have arthritis in my hands and it's so much better and easier than a knife. I got another one for an xmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Christine E. Galbraith

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this gadget!!!
customer_reviews.text: I zipped through 16 dozen ears in no time with this corn zipper!! Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great corn stripper
customer_reviews.text: This works great super sharp. So be careful. Bought it for my husband. Teeth problems. We have corn every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's so easy to use and yes
customer_reviews.text: It's so easy to use and yes...zip zip the corn literally falls into your plate! Quick and easy solution for fresh corn salad!!!
customer_reviews.author: nana

customer_reviews.title: Much faster and easier  than a knife
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp no effort cuts 4 or 5 rows at a time!
customer_reviews.author: tillybug

customer_reviews.title: EASY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought fresh sweet corn yesterday. Once shucked, I used this tool to get the kernels off of the cob to cook later. It did a fabulous job! Much easier than trying to use a knife. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LSUGIRL31

customer_reviews.title: It works, it works!!
customer_reviews.text: This little tool actually does a quick and thorough job in zipping corn off the cob!! I love frying the kernals, so this tool has been a real lifesaver. Only drawback is that it IS sharp; so buyer beware. (no one here has been cut... because we are careful.)
customer_reviews.author: Barbpeyt

customer_reviews.title: Better than knife!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and less messy than trying to "unzip" corn without a knife. To certain, this thing is sharp, but I am kind of shocked at all of the people writing about their injuries. I feel for them, but that sounds like user error, I think.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: They fall out way to easily
customer_reviews.text: The cob holders screw in to the ends of the cob, which means through normal use they will unscrew. You are better off using the old fashioned push in kind.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Dub

customer_reviews.title: The right tool for the job!
customer_reviews.text: The Corn Zipper does a quick and efficient job of removing corn from the cob. We love to blanch, zip, bag and freeze several dozen ears of summer sweet corn to last us through the cold Ohio winter and this tool made the job super quick and easy!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bissinger

customer_reviews.title: awesome too.
customer_reviews.text: works terrific, is sharp as others have said but can do 3 ears in under a minute without even trying. Like that the blade is curved, no knife will do that.
customer_reviews.author: edmocon

customer_reviews.title: Works better than a knife, safer too
customer_reviews.text: I picked 400+ ears of corn this year. Using my good pearing knife to start like last year was time consuming and I cut half the kernels. I did about 50 ears and stuck the rest in my extra fridge. I ordered the corn zipper on Friday, it was delivered Monday, and I canned the rest of my early crop in record (for me) time. Plus, I wasn't nearly as worried about cutting my wrist like with a kitchen knife. I'd recommend this to anyone who wants to can whole kernel corn.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: You never knew you needed this!
customer_reviews.text: Who knew this little gadget could work this well. It removes kernels with ease - no more balancing a cob on its end. Great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Leela20

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Might as well use a knife but it does work
customer_reviews.author: Mnasty

customer_reviews.title: Saves time cutting corn off the cob.
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit of getting used to but once you get the hang of it, it saves you a lot of time. I have recommended it to relatives.
customer_reviews.author: Bj

customer_reviews.title: Best corn zipper
customer_reviews.text: This is the best way to get corn off the cob and ready to be frozen. Kuhn Rikon has some of the best kitchen gadgets and this is a definite keeper! I ordered a couple more to give as gifts - they are that good.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Kipfmiller

customer_reviews.title: Love this, easy to use, super effective and no struggle to cut corn off the cob
customer_reviews.text: Love it but a friend took off the safety cap and managed to nick her finger. Not a serious cut but be very careful even while removing the cap
customer_reviews.author: Karen Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for stripping corn
customer_reviews.text: Who knew there was a simple and effective alternative to stripping corn. For those who don't like to eat corn off of the cob, this little tool is great! I used to use a knife to cut the kernels away from the con, but this little zipper does the trick fast and effectively. I'm buying more for gifts!
customer_reviews.author: D. Sturchio

customer_reviews.title: The blade comes off easily with any pressure against the corn
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 0 stars if I could. The blade comes off easily with any pressure against the corn. Then try to put it back in the holder without cutting yourself. Do not waist your money.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny... Glides through corn like butter and the kernels don't fall everywhere. Best gadget I've bought in years.
customer_reviews.author: DB in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job of cutting the corn off
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job of cutting the corn off. You just have to be careful not to get the end of a finger.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The best thing ever! I purchase lots of corn on the cob. And this item is a must. Cuts in smoothly, handle is sturdy but comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend to others
customer_reviews.text: this corn zipper does work, It sure does cut down on time and the amount of labor it takes to peel the corn off the cob. Would highly recommend to others. Watch you tube to see how it is done. I was really impressed how well it works
customer_reviews.author: nomo

customer_reviews.title: A least it works.
customer_reviews.text: It works...just not sturdy. Blade fell off after second use. You can pop it back in, but annoying non the less. But again, does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: JSH

customer_reviews.title: This product at first worked great but literally fell apart after doing a couple of ...
customer_reviews.text: Every September I buy several dozen ears of corn to freeze for the winter. I was very excited to find there are products out there that assist with this real pain in the a..... job. This product at first worked great but literally fell apart after doing a couple of dozen ear of corn. I tried to put it back together but only succeeded in cutting myself. After 30 minutes of trying I just threw it in the garbage which is where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for those who eat the corn off the cob!
customer_reviews.text: Curved blade works much better with a knife. Of course, you really need to eat corn OFF the cob to really enjoy this--otherwise, don't bother as a knife works very well in a pinch and let's face it, it's one more decent sized item in your kitchen "junk drawer"!
customer_reviews.author: cpareviewlady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for this corn lover
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for this corn lover. Buy a dozen ears, cook all of them eat 2, and cut and freeze the remaining ears works quick and easy..
customer_reviews.author: jmmath@cablelynx.com

customer_reviews.title: Great Time Saver!
customer_reviews.text: Saved me half the time in freezing fresh corn for the Winter! You can use a knife, but this is so much easier and faster! If you haven't done this before, it is so good and you get the fresh taste of homegrown corn all year long! Check out Freezing Fresh Corn on the Internet for instructions. It's super easy and I highly recommend using the method described to make it creamy by scraping the cob. You get every last bit of corn and it makes it super sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Edward A Callicoat

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This tool works great. Removing the kernels takes no time at all. It took a few times to get the spacing down, to get the most kernel, but sooo much better than how i used to do this .. with a knife
customer_reviews.author: Claire Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My mom finally used this for the first time, bought it as a stocking stuffer. She is unable to bit into things but corn on the cob just tastes diff than canned. It was very easy for her to use, she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: COnative

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works, just a little messy attaching and removing, but make eating the corn easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best kitchen tool I have purchased in a long time. Cleans the kernels from the cob so very easily
customer_reviews.author: pls122

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon Corn Zipper
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen tool works great, but keep away from children and your fingers. Very sharp, which is why it works so good.
customer_reviews.author: deborah m.

customer_reviews.title: Neat Gadjet
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this little gadget! It has made the job of taking corn off the cob so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Corn
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use on ear of corn very sharp
customer_reviews.author: sandy

product_meta.title: Kuhn Rikon Corn Zipper 6", Yellow, 6-Inch
product_meta.description: Style Name:Corn zipperUnzips more rows of kernels at the same time, cleanly and safely off of the cob. Safer and more fun than using a knife.
feature_bullets: Teeth cut between kernel and cob and do not bite into the cob.
Kernels drop cleanly into your bowl.
Works in right or left hand.
